intro: Gnaphalium obscurum, commonly known as dark willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium obscurum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in environments with moderate moisture levels.
